intro: Ottosonderia monticola, commonly known as the mountain ottosonderia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, which are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Ottosonderia monticola is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil.
